intro: Gaultheria nubicola, commonly known as the Andean wintergreen, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Its berries, which are typically red or black, are edible and have a sharp, peppery flavor. Gaultheria nubicola is also valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
